page.title: 09ATTITUDES ON ALSTON MOOR
page.content: Of the people we interviewed most had lived in Alston for at least twenty years.{Attitudes}varied but most people liked the new shops as they improve the appearance of the street. Nearly everybody shops in Alston but some did shop elsewhere as well.The majority thought Alston was expensive. Those who used the bus service thought it was quite good but there was a lot of different{opinions. Most people think there are adequate {activities}for the older population but not enough for the young. Of the people we interviewed nobody thought Alston should be expanded or modernised.The cobble stones which are a historic part of Alston should stay. Most people thought that Alston could not survive without tourists.Nearly everyone liked living in Alston.
